docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Without question, the most resilient if not longest survivor in the field of nutritional folklore has been vitamin E. Since its discovery in 1922, megadoses of this fat-soluble vitamin have been recommended as the cure or preventive for a host of perplexing problems, from infertility and impotence to heart and muscle diseases, cancer and the most universal ''disease,'' aging.
